intro: Metagonia meridionalis, commonly known as the southern metagonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, succulent-like foliage and produces small, clustered yellow flowers during the dry season. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, drought-prone environments through its thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access groundwater during periods of extreme dryness. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Metagonia meridionalis is considered vulnerable and is protected in several conservation areas.
